episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" features discussions on Neil Armstrong's moon landing attire, Muhammad Ali's lesser-known comedy album, a historical war over a stolen bucket, and chimpanzees in Zambia using grass as a fashion statement.

facts.fact: When Neil Armstrong stepped on the moon and said "That's one small step for a man," he was wearing ladies underwear.
In 1963, Muhammad Ali released a stand-up comedy album.
In 1325 in Italy, war was declared and 2000 people were killed because of a stolen bucket.
There is a group of chimpanzees in Zambia who wear a blade of grass in their left ear as a fashion statement.
